factions.name: 6th Street
factions.description: Formed by veterans of the 4th Corporate War; moonlights in extortion and smuggling.

factions.name: Albino Alligators
factions.description: Party gang ruling parts of Rancho Coronado; famous for its white-gator mascot and popped collars.

factions.name: The Andersons
factions.description: Aging yogang with a family theme; under threat from the Piranhas.

factions.name: Arzin Tynon
factions.description: Older boostergang operating on Night City’s northern fringe.

factions.name: The Bozos
factions.description: Deadly clown-themed prankster gang locked in an internal prank war.

factions.name: Consortium
factions.description: Tightly organized Russian mob group with ties to the Thelas nomad nation.

factions.name: Culper Ring
factions.description: Secret cell in the Estero Bay Military COG dedicated to reuniting NorCal with the USA.

factions.name: DeadWoods
factions.description: Cowboy-themed gang acting as self-appointed guardians of Night City’s railways.

factions.name: Dirty Hippies
factions.description: Guerrilla gardeners selling drug-laced herbs collectively branded as 'ganga'.

factions.name: Dragula Racers
factions.description: Monster-themed racing gogang.

factions.name: Eastern Tigers Triad
factions.description: Recently arrived Chinese organized-crime ring.

factions.name: Edgerunners Inc
factions.description: Young edgerunners working to reconnect the Old Combat Zone to Night City.

factions.name: El Norte Cartel
factions.description: Mexican cartel expanding into Night City; rumored link to city manager Theresa Valentino.

factions.name: The Enhanced
factions.description: Cyber-cult believing cyberpsychosis is human evolution’s next stage.

factions.name: Eurotrashers
factions.description: Party gang in Little Europe; members sport an unplaceable 'European' accent.

factions.name: The Faded
factions.description: Older edgerunners trying to keep the Old Combat Zone free of Night City intervention.

factions.name: Fixie’s Couriers
factions.description: Collective of bicycle messengers supervised by the fixer 'Fixie'.

factions.name: G3
factions.description: Disturbingly violent anime-themed poser gang.

factions.name: Generation Red
factions.description: Yogang based in the Old Combat Zone.

factions.name: Gold Dragons
factions.description: Protection gang in Little China under David Ling Po.

factions.name: Inquisitors
factions.description: Cyber-hating cult that forcibly removes ware to 'save' souls.

factions.name: Iron Sights
factions.description: Brutal combat gang sponsored by fixer Hornet.

factions.name: Kanzaki Family
factions.description: Last surviving Yakuza faction in Night City; rivals of the Tyger Claws.

factions.name: Kill Krashers
factions.description: New gang that glorifies violence; expanding rapidly.

factions.name: Lightning Cats
factions.description: Bioexotic cat gang prowling the Hot Zone.

factions.name: Maelstrom
factions.description: Combat gang led by Warlock; operates on a ruthless might-makes-right code.

factions.name: Mudang Gumi
factions.description: Netrunner-burglar gang focused on data theft.

factions.name: The Muses
factions.description: Roller-derby poser gang mixing disco and Greek-myth vibes.

factions.name: Philharmonic Vampyres
factions.description: Gang torn between gothic artistry and prankster chaos.

factions.name: Piranhas
factions.description: Night City’s headline party gang—now hosts its own legendary events.

factions.name: Princesses of Justice
factions.description: Poser gang inspired by an old cartoon; protects victims of abuse.

factions.name: Rat Kings
factions.description: A gang known for ambush tactics and drone patrols.

factions.name: Reckoners
factions.description: Nihilistic cult preaching an upcoming 'Harvest of Souls'.

factions.name: Red Chrome Legion
factions.description: Neo-nazi gang locked in attrition warfare with the Iron Sights.

factions.name: Scavvers
factions.description: Cluster of small groups scraping tech from ruins and combat zones.

factions.name: Sinful Adams
factions.description: Goth poser gang haunting the South Night City boneyard.

factions.name: Skiv Family
factions.description: A local gang involved in the shipment dispute.

factions.name: Steel Vaqueros
factions.description: Nomad pack roaming the West Coast; recruits locals as junior packmates.

factions.name: Prime-Time Players
factions.description: Poser gang themed after vintage sitcoms; split into show-based factions.

factions.name: The Shroomers
factions.description: Survivalist-gardener collective farming fungi beneath the Old Combat Zone.

factions.name: The Street Queens
factions.description: Guardian gang defending Night City’s queer communities.

factions.name: The Toecutters
factions.description: Raffen Shiv clan on Night City’s eastern fringe; rumored cannibals.

factions.name: Tombstone Preservers
factions.description: Guardian gang committed to defending the sanctity of the dead.

factions.name: Tyger Claws
factions.description: Former Arasaka proxy gang, now ruling Kabuki and Old Japantown.

factions.name: Undertow
factions.description: Militant anti-gentrification gang active in Little Europe and Downtown.

factions.name: Voodoo Boys
factions.description: Drug-focused poser gang clad in Hollywood-style voodoo trappings.

factions.name: Weng Fang Tong
factions.description: Syndicate running gambling and sex-work rackets; led by David Ling Po.

factions.name: Wild Things
factions.description: Boostergang channeling violence into gladiatorial bouts at the Redline.

factions.name: Willows
factions.description: Therapy-oriented group of female combat veterans.

factions.name: Yellow Brick Road Gang
factions.description: Poser gang modeled after 'The Wizard of Oz'.

factions.name: The Zoners
factions.description: Community-organizer movement improving South Night City living conditions.
